word: I skipped ahead to a page where she used more punctuation and it helped.
tran: 我跳到她使用更多标点符号的页面，这很有帮助。

word: This time you put the punctuation at the beginning of the statement.
tran: 这次您将标点符号放在语句的开头。

word: Lastly, don't forget that punctuation can affect our meaning too.
tran: 最后，不要忘记标点符号也会影响我们的意思。

word: This girl's code, if it is in fact a code, is mostly one continuous line, with hardly any punctuation.
tran: 这个女孩的代码，如果真的是代码的话，大部分都是连续的一行，几乎没有任何标点符号。

word: We have corrected some spelling, punctuation, grammar.
tran: 我们更正了一些拼写、标点符号和语法。

word: But as pack leader, he found himself with a big bullseye on his back.
tran: 但作为狼群首领，他发现自己背上有一个大靶心。

word: Or perhaps he is just a generational pack leader fluent in accidental cool.
tran: 又或许他只是一位擅长意外酷炫的世代领袖。

word: I try to be a good pack leader.
tran: 我努力成为一名优秀的狼群领袖。

word: He was known as father, coach and pack leader.
tran: 他被称为父亲、教练和狼群领袖。

word: Donations can be distancing without a face to go along with the contribution.
tran: 捐款的同时却不露面，会让人感到疏远。

word: This view feels like it's designed to be used along with a mouse.
tran: 这个视图就像是为鼠标而设计的。

word: By early 2013, LucasArts was shut down along with all of its projects.
tran: 到 2013 年初，LucasArts 及其所有项目都已关闭。

word: Make sure to bring down those hanging bird feeders or other patio decorations.
tran: 一定要放下那些悬挂的喂鸟器或其他庭院装饰品。

word: Our main goal is to bring down unnecessary workload on humans.
tran: 我们的主要目标是减少人类不必要的工作量。

word: Communities uplifting, and then law enforcement to bring down the crime.
tran: 社区振奋人心，执法部门打击犯罪。

word: The Trump Administration has had setbacks in efforts to bring down drug prices.
tran: 特朗普政府在降低药价方面遭遇挫折。

word: In one fell swoop, you have created the sprout equivalent of popcorn chicken.
tran: 你一举创造了相当于爆米花鸡肉的新芽。

word: In one fell swoop, the coffee world was about to be upended forever.
tran: 一举颠覆了咖啡世界。

word: Visiting the world's markets could change your life in one fell swoop.
tran: 参观世界市场可能会一举改变你的生活。

word: Then lockdown happened and my diary was cleared in one fell swoop.
tran: 然后锁定发生了，我的日记一下子就清空了。

word: He leaned his whole massive body across the table.
tran: 他把整个庞大的身躯横靠在桌子上。

word: She looked around at the quiet foyer of a massive house.
tran: 她环顾四周，发现这栋大房子的门厅非常安静。

word: The main floor consisted of common areas and wide halls lined with massive windows.
tran: 主楼由公共区域和宽阔的大厅组成，大厅两侧装有巨大的窗户。

word: A massive explosion went off, shaking the ground beneath them.
tran: 一声巨大的爆炸声响起，震动了他们脚下的地面。

word: The most impressive piece was a massive oak table.
tran: 最让人印象深刻的是一张巨大的橡木桌子。

word: The massive warrior paced to the window.
tran: 庞大的战士踱到窗前。

word: The ribbon is red with a central stripe of blue.
tran: 缎带是红色的，中间有一条蓝色条纹。

word: The ribbon is black with a silver stripe at the edges.
tran: 绶带是黑色的，边缘有银色条纹。

word: The skunk had a conspicuous spinal stripe.
tran: 臭鼬的脊柱上有一条明显的条纹。

word: The new cards will come with an embedded microchip instead of a magnetic stripe.
tran: 新卡将用嵌入式微芯片代替磁条。

word: Tasks allow you to break up bits of configuration policy into smaller files.
tran: 任务允许您将配置策略分解成更小的文件。

word: The lesson I learned was never hesitate to break up a championship club.
tran: 我学到的教训是，决不能犹豫不决地拆散一个冠军俱乐部。

word: Addition of more taxa can break up the long branches and increases reliability.
tran: 加入更多分类群可以打散长分支并增加可靠性。

word: Did your partner break up with you after a long relationship?
tran: 您的伴侣是否在长期交往后与您分手？

word: The cat was staring hard at the mouse, as if ready to pounce.
tran: 猫紧盯着老鼠，似乎随时准备扑上去。

word: Cats love to pounce on slow-falling bags.
tran: 猫喜欢扑向缓慢下落的袋子。

word: They've seen the future and are ready to pounce.
tran: 它们已经看到了未来，随时准备扑上去。

word: In the wild, the cat would be preparing to pounce on prey.
tran: 在野外，猫会准备扑向猎物。

word: The leafy stem ends in spikes of small yellow flowers.
tran: 枝繁叶茂的茎上开满了黄色的小花。

word: Green leafy vegetables also contain protein.
tran: 绿叶蔬菜也含有蛋白质。

word: The stable was a leafy bower, dotted with pink, blue and yellow flowers.
tran: 马厩是一个枝繁叶茂的花房，点缀着粉色、蓝色和黄色的花朵。

word: Don't limit your selection of leafy greens to spinach and lettuce.
tran: 不要把绿叶菜的选择局限于菠菜和生菜。

word: For leafy crops, protect them with agricultural cloth or even cheesecloth.
tran: 对于多叶作物，可以用农用布料甚至奶酪布保护它们。

word: The sweet scent of rotting seaweed made her nose wrinkle.
tran: 腐烂海藻的甜香让她的鼻子皱了起来。

word: Dusty and Darian, both drenched and covered in what looked like seaweed, were in the foyer.
tran: 达斯蒂和达里安浑身湿透，身上沾满了像海藻一样的东西，他们都在门厅里。

word: She did it again and again, moving into the brush, where the scent of rotting seaweed came from.
tran: 她一而再、再而三地走进灌木丛，腐烂海藻的香味就是从那里飘来的。

word: All watered in with a touch of seaweed extract.
tran: 所有的水都添加了海藻提取物。

word: The break down of the rotting seaweed can attract hoards of flies.
tran: 腐烂海藻的分解物会吸引成群的苍蝇。

word: I found a gecko behind my waste bin this morning, that's probably what has been keeping down the mosquitoes.
tran: 今天早上，我在垃圾桶后面发现了一只壁虎，可能就是它在驱赶蚊子。

word: An ad that has a boa, a gecko, and a frog in it cannot be posted in multiple sections.
tran: 有蟒蛇、壁虎和青蛙的广告不能在多个版块发布。

word: He is lying still on the ground and does not move.
tran: 他躺在地上一动不动。

word: The clip ends at five seconds, the old man lying still on the concrete.
tran: 片段在五秒后结束，老人躺在水泥地上一动不动。

word: They've possibly been lying still for days now.
tran: 他们可能已经静静地躺了好几天了。

word: He was lying still by the time they reached him.
tran: 当他们到达他身边时，他已经躺在那里一动不动了。

word: It was equally obvious that the group was uniform in their ability to poke fun at one another as well as an unsuspecting visitor.
tran: 同样明显的是，这群人在互相取笑以及取笑毫无戒心的来访者的能力上是一致的。

word: That person happens to be unsuspecting Arthur, apprentice to Merlin.
tran: 这个人恰好是毫无戒心的亚瑟，梅林的学徒。

word: For waste removal, they employed unsuspecting local porters and on one occasion the guide.
tran: 为了清除垃圾，他们雇用了毫无戒心的当地搬运工，有一次还雇用了向导。

word: Cub hunting carried out on a proper principle is one of the secrets of a successful season.
tran: 按照正确的原则狩猎幼崽是一个成功季节的秘诀之一。

word: Galibert was in its earlier form a bag of about 12 cub.
tran: 加里伯特早期的质量是一袋约 12 立方厘米。

word: This, however, shows the bath to be about 2500 cub.
tran: 不过，这表明水量约为 2500 立方。

word: The reservoir is said to contain 130 million cub.
tran: 据说水库的蓄水量为 1.3 亿立方米。

word: Darian got up again, distracting her.
tran: 达里安又站了起来，分散了她的注意力。

word: Don't you think that was more than a little distracting?
tran: 你不觉得这有点让人分心吗？

word: Ashley pulled away, distracting her.
tran: 阿什利拉开了距离，分散了她的注意力。

word: Do not choose an outfit that could be distracting.
tran: 不要选择会分散注意力的服装。

word: As with whales and dolphins they use echolocation when exploring the surrounding environment.
tran: 与鲸鱼和海豚一样，它们在探索周围环境时也使用回声定位。

word: During the search phase echolocation type corresponded to habitat type.
tran: 在搜索阶段，回声定位类型与栖息地类型相对应。

word: Finally, I consider some ways in which bat echolocation has been mimicked by using robotic models.
tran: 最后，我考虑了利用机器人模型模拟蝙蝠回声定位的一些方法。

word: The choices are endless, the hunt so exciting.
tran: 选择是无穷无尽的，狩猎是如此令人兴奋。

word: Thanks a lot for training him to hunt my chickens.
tran: 非常感谢你训练它来猎杀我的鸡。

word: I'd rather feed the animals than hunt them.
tran: 我宁愿喂动物也不想猎杀它们

word: You know, if you want to hunt, I could play wingman for you.
tran: 如果你想打猎 我可以帮你当僚机

word: Eating a little and often as opposed to big meals can ease the symptoms.
tran: 与大餐相比，少吃多餐可以缓解症状。

word: Growing up in a Southern family, big meals were the norm.
tran: 在南方家庭长大，大餐是常态。

word: The PT says he generally eats two big meals a day.
tran: PT 说他一般一天吃两顿大餐。

word: Do you have three big meals or more smaller ones throughout the day?
tran: 您一天吃三顿大餐还是更多的小餐？

word: Flakes of falling snow were fluttering in that light.
tran: 飘落的雪花在灯光下翩翩起舞。

word: She swallowed hard at the question, panic fluttering through her.
tran: 听到这个问题，她使劲咽了咽口水，恐慌的情绪在她的心头涌动。

word: The woman stepped back, one hand fluttering to her throat.
tran: 女人后退了一步，一只手扑向喉咙。

word: She took a step back, heart fluttering.
tran: 她后退了一步，心怦怦直跳。

word: She listened, dread fluttering through her, and sipped her wine.
tran: 她听着，心里涌起一阵恐惧，呷了一口酒。

word: Her hands felt clammy, her nerves fluttering.
tran: 她的手感到冰冷，她的神经在颤抖。

word: But everything changes when she discovers the locusts have a taste for blood.
tran: 但当她发现蝗虫嗜血时，一切都变了。

word: I feel like we all kind of have a taste for the weird and twisted.
tran: 我觉得我们都喜欢怪异扭曲的东西。

word: Arsenal have a taste for it and are looking extremely confident.
tran: 阿森纳对榴莲情有独钟，而且看起来信心十足。

word: But they do have a taste for durian, known as the king of fruits and celebrated in Malaysia.
tran: 但他们确实对榴莲情有独钟，榴莲被称为水果之王，在马来西亚广受欢迎。

word: When the person becomes active, your Portal will make a clicking noise to let you know.
tran: 当人开始活动时，您的门户网站就会发出咔嗒声来通知您。

word: The phone will make a sort of clicking noise, if your sound is turned on.
tran: 如果你的手机声音打开了，手机会发出一种咔哒声。

word: You can stop making your pitch, Brandon.
tran: 你可以停止推销了，布兰登。

word: I invited him to pitch shoes with me but he wouldn't have any of it.
tran: 我邀请他和我一起投球，但他不愿意。

word: She was in the middle of every pitch and fully supported each note.
tran: 她的每一个音都在中间，完全支撑着每一个音符。

word: It was pitch black in the bedroom where I was supposed to get the suit.
tran: 卧室里也是一片漆黑，我本应该在那里拿西装的。

word: They fit together as nice as hot apple pie and a scoop of cold ice cream.
tran: 他们在一起就像热苹果派和一勺冷冰淇淋。

word: Sofi made herself a milkshake consisting of frozen blood from Damian, chocolate syrup, pickles, and a scoop of ice cream.
tran: 索菲给自己做了一杯奶昔，里面有达米安的冷冻血液、巧克力糖浆、泡菜和一勺冰淇淋。

word: Scoop up the paste and rub it on your scars.
tran: 舀出糊状物涂抹在伤疤上。

word: To the right the wall has a large shallow scoop.
tran: 墙的右侧有一个大的浅铲。

word: He let out a long whistle at the doorway.
tran: 他在门口长长地吹了一声口哨。

word: If it would do any good, I would whistle for them.
tran: 如果有什么好处，我会为他们吹口哨。

word: A long train whistle sounded several times, adding to the dark mood of the evening.
tran: 火车长长的汽笛声响了几声，给夜晚增添了几分阴暗的气氛。

word: If the engine whistles, let it whistle till it is hoarse for its pains.
tran: 如果发动机鸣笛，那就让它鸣笛吧，直到声嘶力竭。

word: The whistle was answered, and a maidservant ran out.
tran: 笛声响起，一位女仆跑了出来。

word: With the white LED fans the top blowhole looks ace.
tran: 在白色 LED 风扇的照射下，顶部的喷孔看起来非常漂亮。

word: A single blowhole is located on a slightly raised lump on the front left side of the rostrum.
tran: 单个喷孔位于讲台左前方一个略微凸起的凸块上。

word: Well done you have now finished cutting a blowhole.
tran: 好了，您现在已经完成了吹气孔的切割。

word: Eventually it can reach the upper surface forming a blowhole.
tran: 最终，它可以到达上表面形成一个喷孔。

word: Today was very murky, I was surprised the pics came out at all.
tran: 今天的天气很阴沉，我很惊讶照片能出来。

word: With all these hidden cards things can get pretty murky.
tran: 有了这些隐藏的卡片，一切都会变得非常阴暗。

word: Even then, the legal landscape is still a little murky.
tran: 即便如此，法律的前景仍然有些阴暗。

word: Some types can float in the water often making the water appear hazy or murky.
tran: 有些类型的表镜会漂浮在水面上，往往会使海水显得朦胧或浑浊。

word: Cats possess the innate ability to adjust their position in midair.
tran: 猫天生具有在半空中调整位置的能力。

word: The lenses aren't just hanging in midair, as they sometimes appear to be.
tran: 镜片并不像它们有时看起来那样只是悬在半空中。

word: She waited, but he didn't emerge again.
tran: 她在等待，但他没有再出现。

word: Your scent will soon emerge, always revealing your whereabouts.
tran: 你的气味很快就会出现，总会暴露你的行踪。

word: When he did emerge, he had a hot cheeseburger on a plate.
tran: 当他出现时，盘子里有一个热腾腾的芝士汉堡。

word: Pliny knew that flies emerge from galls.
tran: 普林尼知道苍蝇是从虫瘿里钻出来的。

word: By the end of a meal, usually one name will emerge as the winner.
tran: 一顿饭下来，通常会有一个名字成为赢家。

word: A tusk in the British Museum measures 10 ft.
tran: 大英博物馆里的一根象牙长 10 英尺。

word: Payne in Madras, one tusk measures 6 ft.
tran: 马德拉斯的佩恩象牙长 6 英尺。

word: Our Dogs, The Kennel Magazine, and The Illustrated Kennel News are the remaining canine journals in England.
tran: 我们的狗》（Our Dogs）、《犬舍杂志》（The Kennel Magazine）和《犬舍新闻画报》（The Illustrated Kennel News）是英国仅存的犬类期刊。

word: He touched his canine with his tongue.
tran: 他用舌头碰了碰犬齿。

word: The first upper incisor is much larger than the others; canine and first two premolars rudimentary.
tran: 上部第一颗门牙比其他牙齿大得多；犬齿和前两颗前臼齿很不成熟。

word: Canine Behavior is where you can come to learn why dogs do what they do.
tran: 在这里，您可以了解到犬类行为的原因。

word: She takes the intiative to open a canine deli.
tran: 她主动提出开一家犬类熟食店。

word: The future system I foresee will not be different in substance, but only in degree.
tran: 我所预见的未来制度在实质上没有区别，只是程度不同而已。

word: The substance of thought is language, and language is the one thing to teach the deaf child and every other child.
tran: 思想的实质是语言，而语言是聋哑儿童和其他所有儿童都要学习的东西。

word: The fundamental substance or stroma is colorless and homogeneous.
tran: 基本物质或基质是无色均匀的。

word: She wore an ivory A-line dress with shoes to match.
tran: 她身穿象牙色 A 字裙，脚穿象牙色皮鞋。

word: Ivory, rubber and copal are the chief exports.
tran: 象牙、橡胶和椰干是主要出口产品。

word: They brought with them 3 tons of ivory.
tran: 他们带来了 3 吨象牙。

word: Gold dust, cotton, ivory and gum are also exported.
tran: 金粉、棉花、象牙和树胶也有出口。

word: The name "sea-unicorn" is sometimes applied to the narwhal.
tran: 独角鲸有时被称为 "海独角兽"。

word: His speech about saving the narwhal tugged at my heart-strings and was a perfect example of pathos.
tran: 他关于拯救独角鲸的演讲牵动着我的心弦，是悲怆的完美典范。

word: Afterwards, the group discusses their thoughts and people show off whatever they've sketched.
tran: 之后，大家讨论自己的想法，并炫耀自己画的草图。

word: The actress is choosing a clever time to show off her incredibly toned body.
tran: 这位女演员选择了一个巧妙的时机来炫耀她那令人难以置信的健美身材。

word: Like show off your raw research as you're working on it in the early days.
tran: 就像展示您早期的原始研究一样。

word: He's quick to show off a cherished snapshot of the event.
tran: 他很快就展示了一张珍贵的活动剪影。

word: A product they can wear proudly and show off to friends.
tran: 他们可以自豪地穿戴并向朋友炫耀的产品。

word: The bully will now be more inclined to leave the kid alone.
tran: 恶霸现在更倾向于让孩子独自一人。

word: It seems almost normal to bully or be bullied at school.
tran: 在学校欺凌或被欺负似乎很正常。

word: Ignoring the bully is the best defense since they hate being ignored.
tran: 忽视欺凌者是最好的防御，因为他们讨厌被忽视。

word: Determination was her motivation to stand up to the bully.
tran: 决心是她反抗欺凌的动力。

word: Thunder rumbled again and a cold drop of rain gnawed at the mud on her cheek.
tran: 雷声再次响起，一滴冰冷的雨滴咬着她脸颊上的泥巴。

word: His shoes were covered with mud; he had torn his coat on the thorny tree.
tran: 他的鞋子上沾满了泥巴；他的外套被带刺的树扯破了。

word: Sure, but the only thing in there is mud cats.
tran: 当然，但那里只有泥猫。

word: I promise not to plaster you with mud this time.
tran: 我保证这次不会给你抹上泥巴。

word: Do you feel very sad, and say ' ' poor clam ' '?
tran: 你是否感到非常悲伤，并说 "可怜的蛤蜊"？

word: The menu features fish, clam, shrimp, scallops and chicken tender dinners.
tran: 菜单上有鱼、蛤蜊、虾、扇贝和鸡肉鲜嫩的晚餐。

word: It is most famous for it's clam pizza, made with freshly shucked clams.
tran: 最有名的是用新鲜去壳的蛤蜊制作的蛤蜊披萨。

word: Once the paint is dry, use black paint with a thin brush and draw whisker lines.
tran: 油漆干后，用黑色油漆和细刷子画出胡须线条。

word: Upon the surface is coloring; red for the Bushman, with black whisker though female; white for the European type, with black tattoo patterns.
tran: 表面上有颜色：布什曼人是红色的，虽然是女性，但胡须是黑色的；欧洲人是白色的，身上有黑色的纹身图案。

word: Connie gave him an icy stare.
tran: 康妮冰冷地盯着他。

word: Carmen was so tired that the icy wind failed to keep her awake.
tran: 卡门太累了，冰冷的风也没能让她清醒。

word: Sofi gave her an icy look.
tran: 苏菲冰冷地看了她一眼。

word: Even if it is still a little icy, eating it is fun, just like eating a Popsicle!
tran: 即使还有点结冰，吃起来也很有趣，就像吃冰棍一样！

word: The subject was how Mary had been a vessel to carry the son of god.
tran: 主题是玛丽如何成为承载上帝之子的器皿。

word: The vessel had done much damage to the Federal naval forces, and her destruction was greatly desired.
tran: 这艘船对联邦海军造成了很大的伤害，人们非常希望摧毁她。

word: This was performed with great success, and the vessel was floated off with the evening tide.
tran: 这次行动非常成功，船只随着晚潮而被漂走。

word: Tonopah is at the outcropping of a number of ledges which continue for several hundred feet below the surface for an unknown distance.
tran: 托诺帕位于许多岩架的露出处，这些岩架一直延伸到地表以下数百英尺，距离未知。

word: The creek flowed over a succession of rock ledges and formed pools at the edge where tadpoles swam.
tran: 小溪流过一连串的岩石壁架，在边缘形成水池，蝌蚪在水里游泳。

word: Pull right onto some sloping ledges under the overhanging crack.
tran: 向右拉到悬垂裂缝下方的一些倾斜壁架上。

word: Because it is the mentality that so many mental health issues hang off.
tran: 因为正是这种心态导致了许多心理健康问题。

word: Ideal for hiking or camping, with loops to hang off backpack while you walk.
tran: 非常适合远足或露营，带有环，可在您行走时挂在背包上。

word: He likes to have it hang off usually the left ear.
tran: 他通常喜欢把它挂在左耳上。

word: Every morning when the alarm clock goes off at 7 o'clock, I hit snooze.
tran: 每天早上七点钟闹钟一响，我就去睡觉。

word: He tried to snooze but only managed a wink or two before the plane began its descent into Norfolk.
tran: 他试图打瞌睡，但只眨了一两眼，飞机就开始降落到诺福克。

word: They can be used to wake you up if you are having a mid-day snooze.
tran: 如果您在中午打瞌睡，它们可以用来叫醒您。

word: So, instead, I will put it down to the 5 minute snooze I had on my new Sofa.
tran: 所以，相反，我会把它归因于我在新沙发上睡了 5 分钟。

word: She sat back, dizzy with effort.
tran: 她往后一靠，费力得头晕目眩。

word: She felt dizzy from breathing off the top of her lungs.
tran: 她因用肺呼吸而感到头晕。

word: Maybe being so dizzy is an act with her.
tran: 也许这么晕是她的一种表现。

word: The effort made her dizzy.
tran: 这一努力让她头晕目眩。

word: Another wave of dizziness washed over her.
tran: 又一阵眩晕袭上她的心头。

word: Familiar dizziness assailed her.
tran: 熟悉的眩晕感向她袭来。

word: Outcome depends on the cause of dizziness.
tran: 结果取决于头晕的原因。

word: The messages do not correspond and dizziness results.
tran: 消息不对应，导致头晕。
